p: The amylase production was investigated by starch agar plate method. Briefly, NA medium was supplemented with 1 g/L of starch. One microliter of the isolates was inoculated onto the medium and incubated at 28 °C for 5 days. The positive controls were Escherichia coli (ATCC 25922) and Bacillus cereus (ATCC 10102) while autoclaved distilled water served as a negative control. The plates were then flooded with Gram’s dye solution. The presence of halos around the colonies were indicative amylase production [ 26].
